function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Integration of remote management applications and technologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential disruptions in lead times and prices for infrastructure and equipment due to the pandemic and closed international exchange markets.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vulnerability of globally integrated supply chains due to reliance on single suppliers or vendors concentrated in one country or region.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential labor shortages in coastal us regions with shipping ports due to worker concerns about health and quarantine measures for incoming products.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in shipping containers from china","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shutdown of international suppliers and logistics companies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for distribution and warehouse space","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of contagious diseases in the built environment due to lack of worker protection and health-care facility concerns.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for conflicts and disputes in the construction industry leading to cost and schedule overruns.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disputes over direct vs. incidental impacts of the pandemic on project parties","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of changes in law on construction projects due to pandemic-related regulations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in lien claims and related disputes in construction industry","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of insurance coverage for the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Liquidity crises for construction firms with high debt and low cash revenues","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of coronavirus-related delays on tax incentives for projects","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive pandemic-related considerations in the paper","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on current covid-19 pandemic for research topics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of organizational resilience in construction businesses","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to adapt to ongoing environmental disruptions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective culture based on resilience, change management, and agile principles","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of real-life data or full business cases to evaluate the quantitative impacts of the coronavirus pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of projector company-specific data due to limited data tracking during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of guidelines for handling unprecedented events in the construction industry","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of validation for research results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in acquiring quantitative data during a pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of implementing unvalidated best practices in construction projects","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases due to increased collaboration and reliance on diversified suppliers and manufacturers.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Labor shortage and increase in unemployment levels leading to overcrowded workplaces and job sites.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New research streams related to workforce-related issues, project and workplace considerations, procurement and supply chain implications, and contractual, legal, and insurance aspects.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Future research work on covid-19 in the construction industry could lead to increased exposure to the virus","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Expansion of the study to different countries and sectors may lead to the global spread of covid-19 variants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of smartwatch data and self-reported symptoms to detect covid-19 may lead to false positives or false negatives.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on online detection algorithms may lead to privacy and data security risks for participants’ health data.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on smartwatch data for covid-19 detection may lead to overmedicalization and unnecessary interventions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sample bias due to limited access to wearable devices by older people and low-income populations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependency on large datasets for training detection algorithms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Algorithmic decision-making process reliant on sensor data could be influenced by external factors such as travel, diet, and other health conditions, leading to inaccurate diagnostic outcomes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Individualized decision-making based on large volumes of data may not be accurate or effective in predicting infected individuals.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges related to data security, encryption, ethics, and regulation may arise from the integrated approach of continuous data collection and communication.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on data mining and machine learning may lead to over-reliance on correlations and inaccurate predictions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in academic research centers","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"International collaboration leading to cross-border disease transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on indoor health factors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited attention to occupant health research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on subjective assessments for health evaluation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relation between ieq indoor environmental quality and fatigue, tiredness, headaches, and attention/focus in office and educational buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration of human health knowledge into building design and operation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data-related challenges for delivering buildings that support and promote occupant health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for human-building interactions and spatial organization","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate focus on healthy building principles in design and construction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
